report.report_description: This report provides a neighborhood summary of housing conditions and related health outcomes. It also describes population characteristics that can increase vulnerability to housing hazards.
report.report_text: Categories based on whether the most recent neighborhood value falls among the best, middle or worse performing third of all NYC neighborhoods. NYC is divided into 42 neighborhoods based on the United Hospital Fund (UHF) approach of aggregating zip code areas to approximate Community Planning Districts.
report.report_footer: More data and information on Housing and Health  can be found on the NYC Tracking Portal (www.nyc.gov/health/tracking) and on EpiQuery(www.nyc.gov/health/epiquery). The tracking program is part of the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network (www.cdc.gov/EPHTracking).
report.unreliable_text: **Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_content.report_topic_description: These indicators describe potential sources of allergens and pollutants that can worsen asthma and other health conditions.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Homes with mice or rats in the building (percent)  2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and contribute to the development and exacerbation of asthma and its symptoms.
The saliva, feces, and shedding body parts of cockroaches are an allergen and can trigger asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults who allow smoking in the home (percent)  2013
report_topic_data.indicator_description: A smoke-free home policy can limit people's exposure to secondhand smoke, which is especially dangerous to children.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults reporting mold in the home (percent) 2012
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Mold can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma, and indicate maintenance deficiencies in a building.

report_content.report_topic_description: These indicators describe housing conditions that can affect health.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems (percent) 2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Housing without health-threatening maintenance deficiencies is an important environmental component of health.
Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm residents' health.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_description: Leaks are a maintenance deficiency that can harm health by introducing mold, which can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma.
Older housing and peeling paint can put residents at risk of lead poisoning, due to lead paint - which was banned from household paints in the USA in 1978.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_description: The need for supplemental heat may mean a building's main heat source doesn't work - and can indicate the presence of other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Carbon monoxide incidents without a detector (average annual rate per 10,000 buildings) 2014-2016
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Carbon monoxide detectors are required in NYC homes by law. Failure to provide or maintain a detector can put residents at risk for carbon monoxide poisoning and death.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_description: Air conditioning is an important way to avoid heat stress, especially for persons with limited mobility.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_content.report_topic_description: These indicators describe health outcomes that can be affected by conditions in the home or neighborhood.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma Hospitalizations among Children 5 to 17 Yrs Old (Rate per 10,000 residents) 2016
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma Hospitalizations among Adults (Age-Adjusted Rate per 10,000 residents) 2016
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Children under 6 years with elevated blood lead levels (BLL)(Rate  BLL>=5 per 1,000 tested) 2018
report_topic_data.indicator_description: There is no safe level of lead in the blood. Lead poisoning can cause learning and behavior problems, and delay growth and mental development.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Heat stress hospitalizations (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents) 2015
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Hospitalizations due to heat stress represent part of the public health burden of extreme heat.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_content.report_topic_description: These indicators describe conditions that make a neighborhood more at-risk for housing hazards.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Children under 5 years old in poverty (percent) 2013-17
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Crowding (percent of homes with > 1 person per room), 2013-17
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Occupied housing units with more than one person per room are considered crowded.
